Im in love with her personality, she’s so cute 
Also she’s right about the long hair, it’s so stunning but it’s also a lot of work and gets super annoying so quickly. When I was younger I always had like super long hair and with age it’s started getting curlier and that super long and curly hair literally drove me insane cuz I spent hours taking care of it so I cut it all of to a shoulder length, definitely very emotional and I do miss the long hair sometimes but I do not miss the work

저는 태어날 때부터 선천적인 자연백모?(정확하게는 멜라닌이 없어 살짝 반투명)인데, 염색이 항상 고민입니다.
잘한다는 미용실을 가서 상담을 해도 일반 모발과 달라서 샘플 보고 골라도 어떻게 나올 지 장담 못한다며
밝게 나올 거라면서 샘플대로 나오지 않을 거라더군요.

그런데 청담동 일대를 걷다보면 미용실 원장님들이 탈색머리인 줄 알고 염색 모델하라고 명함을 자주 주는데..
염색에 관심 갖고 막상 찾아가서 선천적인 머리라고 하면 난색을 표하시더라구요.

반투명 모발인데다 남자이다 보니 머리를 짧고 단정하게 자르면 햇볕 받을 때 멀리서 보면 마치 민머리처럼 보이기에

(어차피 백발이다보니 그냥 돌아다녀도 튀어서 주변 사람들이 쳐다보는 시선에는 익숙합니다.)

this is literally hair goals. i'm growing out my buzz cut and i want to grow it out super long like her hair

I feel like she's just got some amazing hair genetics mixed in with how well she takes care of her hair the only reason bleached hair doesn't get long is because most people are really hard on her hair shampooing it every day straightening it curling it blah blah blah I feel like she actually takes time with her hair I am definitely impressed long hair is definitely no easy job though it's not always difficult either
저도 2달전까지 저 절반 조금 안되는 길이러 탈색3+핑크머리4회 유지하고 다녔었는데ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ 대단하시다 전 숱이 진짜 많아서 자르기 전날 양갈래했더니 반 가른게 남들 머리 하나로 묶은 만큼 나오더라고요... 머리가 무겁고 드라이가 힘들어서 잘랐는데 이 영상 보니 또 긴머리 탈색 뽐뿌와요
this was such an adorable episode! kiu was so obsessed with sparkling eyes like a child also she’s super cute with a cute personality. real life rapunzel

Unusually beautiful! I aim to grow my hair to knee length by the end of 2023. It is currently nearly mid-thigh length, and I touch up the colour myself. I never go to salons anymore because they are generally too severe in the way they handle people’s hair. The key is to not overlap the colour on already lightened hair, and not allow any amount of chemicals to touch the hair lengths at all during processing. Also another thing that personally helped is never to use irons, and to be as healthy as possible.

I am watching this for the second time, and really i love Kiu's videos because they are so soothing, low toned and she is especially very sweet. I also have long hair, like hers, same length and i also am left handed and i also use a hair pin because at the end of the day when you are so tired and your arms ache the only two things that work are hair pins and those large u pins. I stopped pony tails and pleating my hair more than ten years ago now and am always on a bun....much like the one Kiu made but not too high. Also i have noticed that now sometimes even a bun makes my head ache so i usually keep them loose when chilling in my room or when sleeping. And i now cannot bear the annoyance of sitting on it that i immediately trim it to my butt every time my hair grows longer. Sometimes everything seems heavy...even a braid. Kudos to the one who bleached her hair, i must say, this was an awesome job, and kudos to her caring routine. The classic blond look has been successfully acheived: she looks lovely MA. looking forward to more videos Kiu Sam.
Ohhh, o cabelo dela é tão lindo. Deve dá tanto trabalho pra cuidar
언니 머리도 너무 예쁜데 말씀하시는 것도 너무 귀여우세요 이쁜 머리 오래오래 유지하시길....

her last sentence is so true. I had really long hair and cut it last week to mid length. Yes, its pretty but also a lot of work and annoying at some point. I hated washing and brushing, mostly wore it in a bun or braided because it was constantly in the way when open and it weighted a lot. Its like they took a few kilo of my head when cutting it. I feel much better now and will not grow my hair this long ever again if I am honest.

i used to have hip length hair and it was thick too, so you can imagine how much work it was... i always wore it in a braid because it was all over the place if i left it loose! i couldn't even do cute hairstyles. a high ponytail would make my head hurt after 30 minutes T-T 

i got it cut up till my chin and it's so easy to take care of now! i can even do adorable hairstyles everyday. it's so much fun!

Grown it out from shoulder length for about 5 years now, and I havent even trimmed it since .It's definitely already a hassle to style it so braids are also my go to, because it shortens the length a bit. That's amazing  My hair reaches just beneath my butt and I've had it bleached only once in order to dye it red. It's not an easy task! This is impressive!

Do to family reasons I couldn't cut my hair until I was 14 or so. My hair was the length hers is in the video, I can promise that you can put it fully up into a bun but it takes many pins to keep it up there. Mine was often braided and then twisted up. I often curled it and did fun styles for events. My mother didn't cut her hair until her 30's and hers was on the floor, she'd step on it while she walked if she didn't braid it up. 

I now keep my hair very very short as it is prone to get very tangled but I split dye it red and blonde. ^_^ This was very entertaning to watch!
Ohhh I'm jealous she's so lucky to have such a hair...it's bleach but really looks shiny and healthy

I think that, the difficulty part will depend on the person, mine is ankle length, and it's the same as if it was back length. It's not bleached tho.  I think I spend the same amount of time on it, as back when it was shorter. The amount of product, tbo if you don't use treatment it will not change much, bcs when washing you should mostly focus on the roots and the length that reaches the shoulders, the rest doesn't need much. Brushing doesn't really take much time so long as it's regular, if days are skipped naturally it will take longer. 
!!!This only applies to straight hair, other hair types will have different requirements.

really a few years ago my hair was like your dark haired girl and people were always paying attention to my hair. I also loved long hair and cared for it in a healthy way. I got depressed last year and started cutting my hair for a change. While I was cutting it little by little, my hair was short all of a sudden. now my hair is at chest level and this is making me very sad. I miss my long hair and it never grows back. When I saw the sweet blonde-haired girl in the video, I felt even more sorry for my own hair. I hope my hair will return to its original length soon.

I have very thick waist lenghth hair. I wash it twice a week. Usually the scalp very well and gently let it run down my fingers massaging. I use thick conditioner for scalp. And regular for the rest ( it's cheaper). I towel dry gently pressing water out. I pic my hair out. A brush is impossible for me- it's that thick. Then I use oils from the middle to the ends. I section it off and blow dry. Picking out tangles gently. I haven't straightened my hair. The only heat I use is my blow dryer. I usually wear a bun or ponytail with cute earrings. People stare at my hair because it's held it's wave and is very thick. Yes my scalp itches even in a bun if I'm sweating alot. It's like wearing a beanie. I also spray body spray on my hair. So it smells nice.
